DataElement.preferredName: Subjective Numeracy Scale Number Probability Preference Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The mean value for the sum of all responses by a person to the preference domain of the Subjective Numeracy Scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Subjective Numeracy Scale Number Probability Preference Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-report measure of perceived ability to perform various mathematical tasks and preference for the use of numerical versus prose information. The 8-item scale contains no mathematics questions and has no correct or incorrect answers. Instead, it consists of 4 questions asking respondents to assess their numerical ability in different contexts and 4 questions asking them to state their preferences for the presentation of numerical and probabilistic information. (Fagerlin, et al., Medical Decision Making, 2007: 27: 672-680):A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.:A measure of the expectation of the occurrence of a particular event.:The act, fact, or principle of giving advantages to some particular person, object, or course of action over others; designated as more desirable.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is an Integer (32-bit two's complement).

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: SNS preference subscale: Average rating on Questions 5-8 (w/ Q7 reverse coded)
